intro: Spergula depauperata, commonly known as the poor sedge, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Spergula depauperata is often found in calcareous soils and is a characteristic species of certain wetland habitats.
